Posts.HTML:
I know you can do

{if pig=true:hello}

But is there a negative for that. As in if pig isn't true then...

Posts.EditableText:
Test 1

```
    set("pig", true);
Hello

[[test]]

[[test]]:
{if pig:SUCCESS}{else:FAILURE}
```

---
Test 2

```
    set("pig", false);
Hello

[[test]]

[[test]]:
{if pig:SUCCESS}{else:FAILURE}
```
Posts.HTML:
Test 1

    set("pig", true);
Hello

[[test]]

[[test]]:
{if pig:SUCCESS}{else:FAILURE}

Test 2

    set("pig", false);
Hello

[[test]]

[[test]]:
{if pig:SUCCESS}{else:FAILURE}

Posts.EditableText:
For the record, ```{if pig=true:hello}``` did NOT work for me.  Neither did ```{if pig==true:hello}```.

Only ```{if pig:hello}``` did the trick.
Posts.HTML:
For the record, {if pig=true:hello} did NOT work for me. Neither did {if pig==true:hello}.

Only {if pig:hello} did the trick.
